arm_group.description: Pasta meal with added fractions or control with no fractions Pasta meal with no pea fractions
Pasta meal with added fractions or control with no fractions 10 g net yellow pea protein added to pasta meal
Pasta meal with added fractions or control with no fractions 7 g net yellow pea fibre added to pasta meal
Pasta meal with added fractions or control with no fractions 10 g net yellow pea protein plus 7 g net yellow pea fibre added to pasta meal

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesized that consuming isolated yellow pea fibre or protein, alone to
      together, as part of a high-carbohydrate pasta meal, would reduce the blood glucose response
      to the meal compared to a meal without yellow pea components and reduce food intake at a
      meal served 2 hours later.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Yellow Pea Protein and Fibre Added to a High-carb Meal on Glycemic Response and Food Intake

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Non-smoking

          -  No metabolic disease

          -  BMI 20 - 25 kg/m^2

          -  male

          -  age 20-30

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Intolerance to treatments

          -  on appetite-modifying medications

          -  restrictive eating

          -  smoking

          -  over or underweight

          -  breakfast-skipping

intervention.intervention_name: Pasta meal with added fractions or control with no fractions

facility.name: University of Toronto - Department of Nutritional Sciences

other_outcome.description: Measured by VAS to ensure palatability is not confounding other outcomes.

authority: Canada: Canadian Institutes of Health Research

primary_outcome.description: Food intake measured via electronic scale in g, then converted to kcal using the caloric density.
primary_outcome.measure: Ad libitum food intake at second pizza meal
primary_outcome.time_frame: 135 mins after completion of treatment, 20 mins to eat pizza meal.

primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose measured via hand-held glucometer and finger prick.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
